Reviews.Title: “Book over the phone or get a surprise on your credit card statement!”
Reviews.Author: Maggie C
Reviews.Content: First, the good: The hotel is clean and in a great location, just off Washington Square in Venice Beach. ow, the bad: We made our reservation through Southwest Airline's website in a package deal with our plane tickets. Weekend rates were slightly higher than weekday rates, as was expected, but the overall price was good. When we checked in we were told that we'd already paid (though the charge hadn't shown up on our credit card statement). Upon checkout, we asked for a receipt and were refused. Specifically we were told that since they'd already charged us (they hadn't), we didn't need to sign off on the charges, so a receipt wouldn't be provided. Uh okay... Then the charge shows up on our card, much higher than the rate we agreed to when making our reservation. After speaking with the manager on the phone, we were told that because the reservation was made with a third party (not an Inn staff member over the phone), the rates could change without notice and a refund would not be issued. We again asked for an itemized receipt and was given the run around. When the manager finally agreed to provide a receipt, he made it difficult. We had to receive a faxed form, fill it out, and fax it back just to have him snail mail a receipt (or so he said...we've yet to receive it). The other issue was that the Inn was under construction. To be fair, we knew this was happening as it was mentioned in our reservation confirmation. However, it was stated on that confirmation (and posted all over the Inn) that the construction would be confined to 9am-5pm Monday through Friday. This was not the case at all! Construction noise could be heard at all hours on all days that we were staying there (Thursday-Sunday). Additionally, the water was turned off not only during the posted construction times, but on Saturday as well. When we mentioned this to the manager while discussing the room rate increase, he stated that he knew for a fact the water was not off on Saturday during our stay. After arguing, he finally said he'd take $30 off the bill after discussing the water situation with his construction crew. All in all, we weren't in the room much during our trip. When we were, it was a constant source of irritation. We won't stay here again because of the poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good choice”
Reviews.Author: solo m
Reviews.Content: I just spent two nights here, during renovations. I was nervous before arriving but Rasha put my mind at ease and was there to greet me when I arrived. It was nice to have a personal connection. My room was on the 3rd floor and was great. Balcony facing the ocean, front door onto the courtyard. It was not quiet, but was extremely spacious and comfortable. Everything was very clean and not at all shabby, so I can only imagine how terrific it will be after renovation. My queen sized bed was very comfortable. The room I was in would be great with a King, as it had high ceilings and was otherwise large. Breakfast was fine--standard motel self-serve. I would classify this hotel as an excellent boutique motel. The location is fabulous, right near the beach and canals. Loved my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Efficient”
Reviews.Author: SamKendal
Reviews.Content: Charming, a little bit quaint, very clean and a good sized comfortable room. A short walk to the beach and night life but not too close to be disturbed. Staff were pleasant and helpful. The setting for breakfast is a relaxing friendly courtyard. Really enjoyed my stay here

Reviews.Title: “what was expected, and a little more!”
Reviews.Author: n31785
Reviews.Content: I had a difficult time choosing between hotels in Marina Del Rey for attending a memorial, but I gave up the ocean view options when I ran into this place. The breakfast, 90s colorful rooms and cute European courtyard had me book pretty much as soon as I saw all of it. I stayed with my parents, and they were very happy with it as well. It really helped that the lady who checked us in made sure we got the room we wanted- that made such a difference with my dad, who started with disliking the hotel to not wanting to leave! Thanks for the service!

Reviews.Title: “Good location at the nicer end of Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: travellers_from_oz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in January, as we wanted to be near the coast, and needed a place with parking. We really enjoyed our time here. It is at the southern end of venice beach, and only a block away from the water (a LOT of hotels in the area are several km away from the beach). It is on the same street as venice fishing pier. Just north of the marina, and at the southern end of the canals. The action end of Venice Boulevard is at the northern end- close enough to walk to, but able to escape from by coming back to the nicer southern end. (Venice boulevard is not a place where you want to be staying right in the middle of all the action). There are plenty of places to eat dinner nearby, from Japanese to Italian to Mexican to bars. Prices were pretty good at all of these places. No laundry on site, and no coin laundry nearby, but there is a cleaners a couple of blocks up the road. Parking on site is plentiful, but costs $7 per day (from memory). Breakfast is great with a lot of variety, held in the pretty courtyard on the first floor. Cleaning is good and rooms are very spacious (we had a rollaway bed for the third person and still had a heap of space to move around the room. Rollaway bed was surprisingly sturdy and good quality). Sometimes street noise can carry through the windows if you are on the Washington Blvd side. Wifi is fast and always worked well while we were there. Staff were always very friendly on the front desk. There is a small fitness centre on site which you can use, or you can walk/run along Venice boulevard (better in the mornings before it gets crowded). I would definitely stay here again when we return to LA at the end of our trip. We booked last minute so prices were a little better, but overall the rates are reasonable, especially for LA. In terms of location this is a great area as parking is plentiful and you can walk around easily at night, and a much nicer atmosphere than Hollywood or Beverley Hills. I prefer Santa Monica but as the hotels there are not in my budget, Venice was an excellent alternative; this hotel has the best location in Venice in proximity to the beach, canals, marina and plenty of eating and drinking options.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but good location and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ThunderBayHiker
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel in a great location so I guess they can justify the prices. The rooms were unremarkable but clean. Good continental breakfast, nice courtyard and within waing distance to piers, beach, shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Big, spacious rooms, beautiful courtyard”
Reviews.Author: UKX
Reviews.Content: Writing this review is making me miss Venice beach ALOT. Hotel was about $170 a night and we stayed 3 nights at the end of our 3 week trip round California, Nevade and Arizona. So glad this was our last hotel as it was beautiful and only 2 minute walk from the beach. The breakfast was great, in the centre of the hotel was a lovely courtyard where you could eat your breakfast outside. We had a balcony whish was lovely to have open in the morning. Although it was foggy and miserable most days (it was October), Venice Beach still had a superb atmosphere and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Only thing I would say is that they do charge you for parking. ALSO, the staff told us not to drive to Los Angeles/Hollywood due to traffic and expensive parking, and that they do bus trips there (I rmeber it being quite expensive), But me and my boyfriend took the chance and drove, parking was only $10 for the 24hrs in a multi storey just off Sunset Boulevard and it only took 20 mins to drive there and 20 minutes back. Traffic really isn't that bad in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “A great New Years Eve in Venice (Beach)”
Reviews.Author: HerfromFrome
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were super and did all they could to make us comfy when we arrived slighly bedraggled and tired after an amazing two weeks in Hawai'i. It was after 10pm on New Years Eve anmd I'm sure they wanted to get out to their own celebrations, but helped us with everything including a range of restaurant possibilities that would still be open. The beds were fabulous, and the room roomy. The shower was really great - good flow and great shower head. Breakfast was self service, with a range of foods on offer - muffins (english and american) toast, cereals, cold boiled eggs (just...why?) I would stay here again in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & convenient”
Reviews.Author: Shazmoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn in November 2011, for a few nights. Was a great location, really close to some nice restaurants and the beach. Not a fancy hotel, but really clean and comfortable and helpful staff. We didn't have a view from our room (it was facing the car park), but quiet and no problems with street noise. Also close to the breakfast room which was handy. Overall a great little hotel, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem”
Reviews.Author: verason
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times in my single days. This is NOT the Ritz-Carlton but this hotel is 2 blocks from Venice beach and 1 block from the Venice Canals which are both a must-see. The hotel is clean, and the staff friendly and helpful. They offer free continental breakfast which was ok. There are plenty of eating establishments in the general area. The room was simple and clean. Try to get a room with a balcony view of the courtyard, it's a different experience. Great value here!

Reviews.Title: “The Little Treasure”
Reviews.Author: LilyLZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in 2011. It is a very nice, clean, and friendly hotel. The room is spacious. The location is great - very close to all the restaurants and the sea front. It is also within 20 mins drive to Santa Monica and Downtown LA. The price is great - it is even including breakfast - best bagels from there ever - yummy!!!!! The downside is that I found this hotel was a bit smelly - it had the old and damp smell. But with that price, I don't mind. I will definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located Little Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RDB27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this small hotel overnight and asked for a quiet room, since other reviewers had mentioned some noise from the busy street in front of the hotel. Not only was the room quiet, but very convenient to the elevator and the breakfast room. Our king-sized bedded room was spacious and equipped with all amenities(except a makeup mirror). The room was clean, well-decorated, and well-lighted. The "continental" breakfast was very adequate. If the weather had been warmer, we would have enjoyed eating our breakfast outside in their lovely atrium, where lovely plantings abounded. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Our short stay was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ap1090
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a night stop over in Venice because it watoday accessable to the airport. I had read reviews on tripadvisor and was so impressed with the service from the moment we walked in.. We arrived at 9am and they let us in well before our check in time and allowed us to have breakfast. Which was perfect after a 15 hours flight. The rooms were spacious and very clean. A lovel walk to Venice beach and a little further to Santa Monica. I would definitely stay there again. 10/10 and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly super clean in Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: Drjkauai
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did not want another impersonal, huge hotel with all the amenities but one that lacked warmth. So we decided on the Inn at Venice Beach. It was wonderful. The staff and I mean all of the staff were friendly, considerate and attentive. In addition I was really impressed with the cleanliness of the entire hotel which included our room and extended to the car park. I will definitely stay at the Inn at Venice Beach should I be traveling to LA again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: am84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights during our honeymoon. We splurged and got a suite, which was a lovely, spacious, and clean two-floor loft. The hotel staff was friendly, and we appreciated the complimentary breakfast. Walking distance to Venice Beach and close to Santa Monica. Lots of restaurants and shopping in the area. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: frothygirl
Reviews.Content: Booked remotely and were unsure what to expect. Have been delighted. Rasha at reception was extremely helpful. When we checked in during a heatwave our fan didn't work so she swapped our room immediately and made recommendations about tours, restaurants and where to go. We had a loft room which was well priced for the location and gave us plenty of space for 3 nights. Our new room is on Washington Blvd, so is a bit noisy but this didn't worry us at all. Parking on site at $7 per day. Breakfast is continental - cereal, breads, boiled eggs. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to Venice attractions and Santa Monica”
Reviews.Author: snorkelinthesun
Reviews.Content: For a first trip to Venice, this hotel was great. Easy parking good proximity to the beach and Venice canals. Amenities at the hotel were also nice (robe, in room coffee and continental breakfast). I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The room from Hell”
Reviews.Author: Airman153
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night because it is part of the Pacifica Hotels group and we had had good experiences with two of their other hotels along the California coast Pacifica Suites, Goleta, and Sandcastle Inn, Pismo Beach). But, as we found out to our great discomfort, the Inn at Venice Beach definitely does not come up to the same standard of quality as the others, even thoug it was the most expensive of all three Pacifica Hotels that we stayed at during this trip. Up front, the only positive comment I have is that the room was clean and the bed comfortable, although the television set was a vintage crt model (all other hotels we stayed at had large flat screen HD television sets). We had reserved a room with King bed, but when we arrived were informed that the only one available was at the front of the hotel, above the lobby, which fronts onto a very busy thoroughfare. The room had absolutely no sound-proofing - single glazed metal frame windows that do nothing to stop the noise of all-night busy traffic. We could plainly hear the conversations of people on the sidewalk below (there are parking spaces along the curb outside the lobby), and at a nearby bus stop. Late into the night, and early next morning, buses frequently pulled up to the stop and then accelerated noisily away. To make the situation worse, there was a gap around the in-wall room heater/air conditioner that was so large that we could see daylight through it. So the street noise just traveled straight through the gap as well. We spent a very disturbed night with little sleep. Next morning, a Saturday, continental breakfast was supposed to be available until 10:30 am, but the coffee and juices were all gone by 10 am, and althought there was nothing to drink, no one came by to refill them. We complained later to the receptionist, but he countered by saying there was a phone in the breakfast room that we could have used to call for assistance. I saw no phone, so if you read this Inn at Venice Beach, how about putting a sign in the room to inform guests on how to get assistance? We were glad we had only checked in for one night, and were glad to make our way home next day. Don't stay here unless you are deaf, or want to party all night.

Reviews.Title: “great location , lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: LAR0cks
Reviews.Content: We are Scottish girls and holiday in Venice Beach every year! We have stayed at the Inn three times and love the location. Five minutes walk to beach and excellent restaurants and Bars. Alphonso on Reception is Fantastic and we now treat him as an old friend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel near enough to the beach”
Reviews.Author: Kevin186220
Reviews.Content: This was a nice Motel/Hotel that is close enough to Venice Beach. Good breakfast and clean rooms. It was a good place to be on our last night. The only downside parking was charged again. As I said it was our last night on our road trip around California, Arizona and Nevada. We had good, middle and bad places to stay depending also how much each place charged. The best value for money was Bally's in Las Vegas. The most luxorious was The Village Lodge Mammoth Lakes and not too expensive closely followed by a B&B in Morro Bay.. The worst place was I'm afraid Caverns Inn ( really poor) near the Grand Canyon followed closely by the Venice Beach House also for poor accomodation compared with value for money, the Venice Beach House even charged $20 for parking. I still can't get over the $368 charged for one night poor B&B (Â£250). Another problem which I think will affect the tourist industry is the cost of eating out. It has got very expensive, although you still get large meals. All in all a great holiday touring around and staying in 12 different places from LA to San Francisco via the Grand Canyon. Thank you America!

Reviews.Title: “Great, little hotel, fab location”
Reviews.Author: Julie C
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for us and I was a bit worried about us staying there with two teens after reading the reviews of Venice Beach on Trip Ad, however I am so pleased it didn't out me off. The hotel it self was great, the staff very friendly and helpful, the rooms clean, and the location - 2 mins from Venice Beach boardwalk and beach was just fantastic! Don't come if you want a boring corporate hotel room, this isn't the place for you, but if you like quirky, individual then do pay it a visit. It isn't a big hotel and there is no pool, but the breakfast courtyard was lovely and the breakfast providing cereals, bagels, toast, fruit etc was plentiful. We did a road trip and after staying ot each hotel gave it a score for location,room, staff, and breakfast and of the 5 hotels we stayed at this one won!

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel and probably will come back”
Reviews.Author: cpattz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from july 10th to july 22th, so 12 nights. People are very welcoming, nice and helpfull (a special note for Rasha). I had the room # 112: the door is on the courtyard and the balcony on the hotel parking; it's clean, spacious and very quiet. The hotel is only 5 minutes walk to the beach and there's a bus stop just in front. There's a market just next door and people out there are also very kind, welcoming and always ready to help. The breakfast is good too. The only point is for the internet: it's told " free high speed internet" but it was very difficult to connect and when connected you never know for how long; it's the only negative point. So I recommand this hotel with just one advice: ask for a room on the courtyard or on the hotel parking, cause I could hear that rooms on the street are very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, comfortable but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: GCAW29
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights while checking out colleges (close to LMU, USC, UCLA, bit further to UCI, Pepperdine and many others). Rooms were fine. Yes, they are smaller than some modern Marriott but you are in an older building with far fewer rooms. Breakfast was basic (cereal, croissants, bagels, fruit, etc) but plentiful. Eating in the central courtyard was pleasant but you might have to wait for a table at rush hour (though we never did). One morning we ate at a local restaurant (3 minutes walk) and there were several to choose from. Staff were all very polite and helpful. The desk can arrange transport and tours. Parking was plenty but $7 a night. But bear in mind you are only a block from the beach and so parking is at a premium especially on weekends. Speaking of which, Washington Blvd backed up for a mile or so on the Saturday, with people heading to the beach, though it had cleared by 4pm. Location is great if you want to hit the beaches or walk the front. There are a number of restaurants in a short walk, and the ones we tried had good food and reasonable prices. Also tried one on Admiralty Way (a 20 minute walk over to Marina del Rey) but it was much more expensive and not much better food. A few people have complained of the noise, but we didn't get too much of that. Certainly the streets are quiet by around 11pm, and I guess our neighbours were on the same timing as us as their running water wasnt an issue. Free wifi worked in both our rooms with no problem (1 room on 1st floor and other on 3rd floor loft) and my boys managed to stream Netflix so bandwidth was pretty good. The fitness center was simple and the treadmill gave up after 5 minutes, so no points there, but at least they had one, and it was free. Overall, we would definitely consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “The most helpful hotel - ever!”
Reviews.Author: MacqueenSydney
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at The Inn at Venice last September and found the service and comfort fantastic - so when we were again in LA with our family and friends, decided to try and get a few rooms over the weekend. We drove up from Newport Beach and turned up without reservations. When we arrived, we were told by Rasha that there was no availability, however then she did the incredible - she picked up the phone and started calling hotels in the area for us... We're from Australia, and not used to this type of service! What Rasha ended up doing was finding us a great Hotel, not far away, and she even negotiated a fantastic rate - we just couldn't believe it! We loved our other hotel and silently thanked Rasha every day, but we can guarantee that the next time we're in Venice, we will only stay at The Inn at Venice, because of such incredible service - absolutely above and beyond our expectations!! A footnote: To Rasha's Boss - you have an incredible lady working for you!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: finfred
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May and June. The room was spacious and clean. Parking is safe and free. The staff, especially Alfonso and Elisa, and the maids and the breakfast staff, were gracious and helpful. The rates include a very good continental breakfast with hard boiled eggs, waffles, fresh juices, bagels and fresh fruit -- bananas, apples and oranges. The breakfast area is both indoors and outdoors (on a charming open air courtyard with a fountain and flowers -- its like you are in the New Orleans French Quarter -- REALLY!!!). The room itself was large sized, well laid out; a queen bed with high end linens, great bedpillows -- I was asleep immediately each night). Our room opened into the quiet courtyard and had a small side balcony. The location on Washington Blvd in Venice (charming little City -- canals, beach etc.) is excellent with many restaurants and shops within walking distance of the hotel (don't drive around -- WALK! -- parking is valeted for the street AND beach parking is expensive!!). I have stayed at several other hotels of the hotel group and I highly recommend the Inn at Venice Beach. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you are planning to spend time in Venice Beach and don't need sleep.”
Reviews.Author: lthrmusic
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in my stay last week at the Inn at Venice Beach. If you are looking to stay at Venice Beach/Marina Del Ray area for your entire trip the hotel might be worth it because of location. If you are planning for one day in this area or don't mind driving in and paying for parking you are better off. The rate I paid for this room was not worth the price. My room overlooked a busy outdoor restaurant and it was noisy until 1 or 2 in the morning. I asked to change rooms and the only other rooms were along the busy street into town. The walls are paper thin and I could hear everything the guests were doing in the room next door. Breakfast was typical continental fare. The room smelt really bad and the furnishings were old or outdated. I thought for 155 per night I would have better accomadations. I paid for only for the luxury of staying near the beach. After one day it was enough. I wish I had spent the money elsewhere and just drove in and paid for the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shakes96
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently and had a great stay. The rooms were spacious and clean, parking was safe and free and the staff were very friendly welcoming. The rates included a good continental breakfast with an excellent choice. The room itself was a reasonable size with decent linens and a comfortable bed. Our room overlooked the main road, but we didn't really hear much traffic so it was no big deal. The location was excellent with restaurants and shops within a minute of the hotel. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value near the beach”
Reviews.Author: nuacara
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good value with a great location and a bit of personality. I loved the palazzo feel to the courtyard where breakfast is laid out. The decor was definitely more colorful than chain hotel, but not jarring. The staff was super friendly and helpful. I found it totally disconcerting that there were signs warning me that there are chemicals in the building which cause cancer - maybe the risk is minimal, but without more information about what the chemicals are, how high the risk is, what one has to do to be at risk (ie, are we talking lead paint that I'd have to chew on the walls to be affected by, or is it something in the pipes or the air ducts?) it was just unsettling. A little bit of street noise, but nothing bad enough to interfere with sleep. On the whole, a good value and I would stay there again. But before I booked a room with kids, the eldery or a pregnant woman, I would want to know what was up with those warnings, and I'd be annoyed if I didn't find out about them until after I checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: cacalo
Reviews.Content: Room was very small and didn't look any better then Motel 6. I thought it was not worth the money. When it was time to sleep, I so regretted staying at this hotel. I could hear all night long water running in other peoples bathrooms. Noises in other rooms were annoying (Your could every "everything"). Yes, staff was friendly, but that is of no use when you cannot sleep and you're yawning at the beach on the next day. I personally would not recommend this place (unless you're used to the Motel 6 rooms).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: dalycalifornia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fun and eclectic. It's near the beach but not on the beach which in Venice is perfect. If you've been there you understand... You can walk to zillions of great restaurants, bars and cafes as well as the gorgeous beach and entertaining boardwalk. The hotel was surprisingly quiet considering it's on a major street. Parking is inexpensive for L.A. Bathrooms may be small but the room has a "coffee bar" with mirror where you can spread out your toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SWGH123
Reviews.Content: Good value for the location. Loft Apartment was certainly large and clean - maybe a bit dated (especially the bathroom) and breakfast bar was okay but rather limited. Overall worthwhile option if you are keen to stay at Venice Beach. Very close to restaurants and the beach.

Reviews.Title: “unexpectedly good”
Reviews.Author: winequaffer
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate, sounded good.... the area seemed seedy... but 3 min walk to beach and some average restaurants. The hotel turned out to be a great deal... good parking.. huge and super clean room. Nice staff... in the end l liked the place alot and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Inn at Venice Beach makes my vacations perfect.”
Reviews.Author: jclashman
Reviews.Content: I love the Inn because it is so close to the beach and many excellent restaurants. It really is in the coolest neighborhood in the US. That is why I vacation there. It is walkably close to the hotspots of Venice while remaining elegant.

Reviews.Title: “LA Beach Vacation”
Reviews.Author: daisygirl59
Reviews.Content: I looked all over for a hotel close to the beach and settled on the Inn at Venice Beach, given our budget didn't allow for luxury. My teen kids loved the location near the beach and all the funkiness of Venice, plus it's not too far from Santa Monica, which is more upscale. The rooms do have a noise problem, no doubt. We were moved from one facing on the busy street to another near the back that still had noise problems from the always-running generator at the Mexican restaurant next door. Plus the room was smaller than the one we'd had though in theory they were both suites. Housekeeping staff were very thorough and we had no issues with the rooms' cleanliness. We loved the nearby restaurants including the incredible C & O Trattoria. The weather turned out to be so chilly we didn't go to the beach as much as we had planned but the beach is just down the block if you have the opportunity. All in all a good stay and I would recommend as long as you understand it is a pleasant, clean, well staffed hotel in a fantastic location--but not a luxury inn.

Reviews.Title: “L.A. Serenissima”
Reviews.Author: Balding_Bon_Viveur
Reviews.Content: Apologies for the pun! Venice beach in itself is a great spot to stay, big beach, good weather, easy access to Santa Monica, and a great little scene at Venice Beach itself. This hotel is within 5 moninutes walk of Marina Del Rey, The Canals, and The Beaches. Also the Boardwalk, Muscle Beach & The bars, cafes and restaurants of Abbot Street. The hotel has spacious rooms, which are well kept - if a little dated, and a delightful central breakfast terrace which the rooms look onto. There is a fitness room, and internet access in the reception area, and the staff on reception were all extra polite and helpful. In Short a great little place to stay, and a millio0n miles from the urban sprawl of LA that you may be concerned about. Oh did I mention breakfast thrown in and free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Cool little hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: Lin_Paul18
Reviews.Content: Reciently had a great stay at The Inn At Venice beach.parking ideal and secure, check in was a breeze ,loft room huge, ac was in the form of a roof fan and we did find it a bit hot during the night,breakfast was basic but free. Love the location,,lots of lovely bars and restaurants near by and the beach is a 2 min walk away. Hired a bike and cycled to Santa Monica peer.great fun. Would like to recommend the Terrace restaurant just near beach,had a great calamiri starter and steak main, great value. Loved our stay at Venice Beach.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: LEH16
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I have stayed there with my family and have taken school trips and stayed there with a large group. I wouldn't stay anywhere else. It is a beautiful, quaint hotel. The rooms are super clean, really nice linens, comfortable beds, spacious, and all surrounding a sweet courtyard. Breakfasts are perfect with some hot options, good coffee, eggs, cereal, and a really nice environment to eat in. The staff is fantastic. Everyone, from the front desk to the maintenance staff, is friendly. Everything is always smooth when I make reservations. Honestly, I feel as if they bend over backwards to accommodate our every request when we travel there with our school. We are from a private school and our parents have very high standards for quality and safety. I feel confident staying there with kids. It is perfectly located--just a few blocks from the beautiful beach at the end of Washington Blvd, yet, far enough away from the "crazy" side of Venice Beach. The restaunts that are walking distance on Washington Blvd are super nice. Love the local coffee shop with the cow on the roof and C & O Italian. On top of all this goodness, you won't find a better price in town for a hotel with such close access to the ocean. Stop looking, stay here, The Inn at Venice Beach is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The staff, breakfast and food were great”
Reviews.Author: SulaHavana
Reviews.Content: While visiting my son who lives in the area, my mother aged 88, and I stayed at the Inn for 5 nights. Mother has a wheel chair and we used wheel chair parking for only $7 per night and undercover. Staff were very accomodating and the breakfast was great. Good location. Friendly and safe neighbourhood for walking. Marina, Beach and cannals are all great walks and close by. Hertz car rental was just a 15 minute walk away. Highly recommend this hotel for a pleasant, affordable stay in the Venice area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: burns625
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were more than impressed with this small hotel. It was clean, nicely decorated, with good service, good location, parking, adequate breakfast. Quiet. We liked being near the beach and the canals. I did not feel that it was old or poorly maintained as one reviewer said. I appreciated the discounted Fall rate.

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach and shops”
Reviews.Author: everlasting_summer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first 2 nights of our trip in the USA. After a long flight from Australia, it was good to be close to the airport, but still able to spend time at the beach and visit tourist attractions. The hotel and room were colourful and fresh. Room and bathroom were clean and confortable. It was great to hire a bike just down the street and ride on the boardwalk up to Santa Monica. There are some good restaurants in the street - I particularly recommend Bin 42 - amazing pizza and sweet potato chips! The room was a bit noisy on weekends and there werent many facilities at the hotel, however the complimentary breakfast was a great start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Ã¡ Real Flop House”
Reviews.Author: Mel_Paris
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to understand how other TripAdvisor devotees could find The Inn at Venice Beach acceptable. It is aging, barely renovated former beach apartment house. The good part: It is well located, near the beach. The beds are very comfortable even though they are queen size. There are a number of nice, if funky restaurants nearby. The hotel has adequate parking. The staff is friendly if somewhat amateurish. The rest: One is greeted upon entry with a sign warning that the building contains toxic materials that can be dangerous to oneâ€™s health. When I asked for the brochure describing these toxic materials, the clerk could not locate a copy. He mumbled something about proposition 65, but never produced an explanation of the toxins. The building is old, funky and in serious need of renovation. The bathroom was so small that one had to navigate to get in and out. The bathtub / shower combination was old with lots of black mold growing between the tiles. The blankets on the beds were stained and torn. A true flop house. Our room was on a corner was so noisy that we could not sleep. There was noise from traffic, from people walking on the sidewalks, and from the interior halls of the hotel. A true insult. The ventilating fan in the bathroom would have put a Mack truck to shame. The room was dark and poorly lighted. Only one of the two floor lamps worked. The small refrigerator tucked into an alcove added to the noise pollution. But, worst of all was the old through-the-wall air conditioner. Its noise level rivaled a jet aircraft taking off. We turned it off rather than suffer the noise. When we asked about why there were no double pane windows, we again were given a mumbled answer that the walls were too thin to allow the installation of noise resisting windows. Total nonsense. Then there was the shower. When the hot water finally arrived, it was regularly laced with freezing cold water. No adjustment was possible. Unless one is in love with the location of the Inn at Venice Beach, or attracted to noisy, funky, old, in need of repair lodgings, donâ€™t bother.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms are comfortable, clean, and roomy.”
Reviews.Author: skecanj
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the inner cobblestoned courtyard with wrought iron chairs, a fountain, and where you can eat the complimentary breakfast in the morning. The room (we had a loft suite) was clean, extremely roomy, and had a refrigerator, in-room coffee, and free Internet. It would be perfect for families or a small group of friends. There was just two of us, but we thoroughly enjoyed the spaciousness of the room. Even though we were right on the street, we never heard any noise. There is also a business center with free computer use & Internet in the lobby. One of the best things is the reasonable price + the location. It's only a couple of blocks from the pier, boardwalk, and the canals. LOTS of stuff going on in the boardwalk area. Just down the street near the beach is a whole block of restaurants, some are sidewalk cafes. There's also a small grocery store in that block. It's a small hotel, but you really can't beat it for the area. I would definitely go back again. Had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: BARB54Narberth
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a stop off on our way to Tahiti. We did not want to do "corporate at the airport" and thought the Inn looked nice with a beach location. We were very happy with the Inn and it exceeded our expectations. Location is 1 block from the beach with plenty of restaurants nearby and a overall "funky" feel. A continental breakfast is include with a beautiful courtyard with fountain area to relax in. The rooms are a nice size and are kept very clean. This is a nice boutique hotel with a personable staff who go the extra mile to make your visit pleasant. Thanks to Alphonso and Courtney at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: naturegirlmeetschic
Reviews.Content: Challenging time conversing with the front desk manager. If you need a crib you should bring your own . They only have two and they won't reserve one for you! They have a first come first serve rule regarding their cribs. The decor is CHEEZY! We paid over two hundred dollars a night for a QUEEN bed. The bed wasn't comfortable and the pillows were too soft. The room was clean and spacious. Be careful where your room is located. We were right across the street from the Baja Cantina and it was loud. They knew I had a toddler and this is where they put us. I requested a month in advance a quiet location. My request wasn't granted at all! They finally delivered a crib and the blanket inside the crib smelled of urine and body odor. I put it on the floor the next morning for the cleaning service to take it away and they folded it back up and put it on the bed. The sink made a VERY loud gargling sound every time the room above us had their shower on. Upon checkout I mentioned the sink noise and the response I got back was, "you need to jiggle it when you hear that sound." HELLO...I am paying to stay here and I have NO desire to be a plumber or fiddle around with a sink during my stay. I could hear conversations from the adjacent rooms. Overall, this hotel is located in a fantastic area. Decent breakfast with a nice terrace to enjoy the eats. I wouldn't go back or suggest this hotel to anyone I know. Overpriced and very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at good price!!!”
Reviews.Author: FamofFive_10
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed here for a short summer trip. The room was clean and nice size. The staff was great and the breakfast in the courtyard was a great addition to our stay. This hotel is steps from the Venice canals, several restaurants and a five minute walk to the beach. Great spot for family since Santa Monica Pier is just a short drive and great getaway for a grown up vacation too. Hotel parking is only $7.00 and warm chocolate cookies at checkin. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff, clean rooms, lots of amenities included!”
Reviews.Author: JHENHAPL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. We had no idea about the Venice Beach area but heard it was a fun place to stay. We chose the Inn at Venice Beach because of the location and price. From the time we checked in, the staff was friendly and extremely helpful! Breakfast is included and was a step above the average continental breakfast-included bagels, waffles, and hard boiled eggs. Wi-fi is also included for free and it is a fast connection. The Inn is two blocks away from the beach, and about three blocks down from Muscle Beach....some really great people watching!!! There are some really great restaurants in walking distance. We really enjoyed C & O Trattoria...great Italian for a great price. We had pizza delivered one night...Lenzini's Pizza. Fast delivery at a great price. Overall, we were extremely satisfied with The Inn at Venice Beach!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply...loved it”
Reviews.Author: Chanteuse_16
Reviews.Content: Okay people. This review is waaaaaay overdue. Searched and searched for a hotel in the Marina Del Rey area and came up with this renovated boutique hotel. Was concerned about where to stay because our trip was 9 days long. Must say that I am a cleanliness freak. Did I mention "cleanliness freak"?! Traveled with a friend and stayed in one of the loft rooms. Very convenient. Room at the back of the hotel. Queen size bed upstairs. Queen size pull-out bed downstairs. It worked out perfectly. Only had one issue upon arriving and that was quickly taken care of. Our room was cleaned well everyday. Everyone was friendly. EVERYONE, from the maintenance man to the housekeepers to the front desk, especially Alfonso. He really made the stay nice. Must love the breakfast. Lots of bread-type goodies. Hard-boiled eggs. Juices. Hot and cold cereal. And, fresh fruit...bananas, apples and oranges. It reminds me so much of Europe. There was a wonderful courtyard, but we never sat in it because of the weather being a bit chilly. Next time. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone. And, I'm picky. Was sick while I was there. The housekeepers always made sure that I had extra towels and extra pillows. If you're looking for the big-time chain hotel, this is not that. But, if you're looking for something different that is close to the beach and near good restaurants, chose this hotel. I cannot say enough good things about it. They really made my stay enjoyable. The next time I'm in the Marina Del Rey/Venice Beach area, I will definitely chose the Inn at Venice Beach. Hey! I'm a card-carrying Marriott member, which is only about 5 blocks away. I must have really enjoyed myself to say that I would rather stay here than earn points. Inn at Venice Beach. Be about it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel - I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Until_It_Sleeps
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with two family members for 6 nights. We rented the loft room and they took the bed in the upper section while I slept on the futon on the main level. We had a third floor apartment facing Washington Blvd. The loft room had a small kitchenette where there was a mini fridge, a sink, and a coffee maker. The hotel seemed like it was in fine shape. First and foremost, the hotel had a great location. The walk to the Venice pier, the beach, and the boardwalk was only 2 or 3 minutes. Santa Monica was only a few miles to the North as well. The carpets in the hotel may be a little old but the rooms, blankets, and towels all smelled clean. Everything was nicely cleaned in the kitchenette and bathroom as well. There was a large CRT TV on both levels of the loft. The futon was comfortable enough, I had no problems sleeping on it. Light sleepers should beware of the noise coming from the street. There is a bar/club located just down the street where there were live bands and loud people until around midnight on weekends and one of the weeknights that we were there. We didn't mind much, and found the noise to be more than tolerable when you simply left the patio door shut. We opted to leave ours open most nights, but I am a very heavy sleeper. I awoke to the sound of a jackhammer that had apparently been drilling across the street for the last 2 hours, so noise was no issue for me. The service was very good. We would head down for breakfast and by the time we got back up to our room it would already be finished. They would neatly remake the beds and replace all of the towels, and also replaced the creams and such that were complimentary and a big help. The continental breakfast was delicious. They had a reasonable assortment of coffee, juices, bagels, pastries, and fruits to choose from. The dining room was clean, but we chose to eat in the courtyard every morning. It was a very nice setting with a fountain and was open to the elements (no roof) which was a nice way to start each morning. The receptionists were all very nice to us. They would always smile and greet us everytime we came back into the hotel and seemed like genuinely kind people. There was also the convenient computer with a printer in the lobby where we were able to print off our boarding passes. There was lots of parking for the hotel available at $7 a day which was fair. All in all, I would gladly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome price in a very nice part of Venice Beach!”
Reviews.Author: willth78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal if you like feeling less tourist as you usually feel in a hotel. The price is unbeatable for what you get. Cute little breakfast, parking on the property, very nice staff. Totally worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Awful front desk and rude management”
Reviews.Author: CostalTraveler55
Reviews.Content: For the price you pay to stay there you'd think they'd be able to do the most simple thing like answer the phone. I had to call 3 times before someone picked up, and when I did it was loud. I could barely hear the person on the phone, all I could hear were other people laughing and talking in the background. I tried to speak with a manager but I was questioned like a criminal about why I wanted to speak with someone and then when I talked to the manager I was dismissed. Won't ever stay here, won't have clients stay here, won't even let my dog walk by here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Dromomaniac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the In at Venice Beach for 3 nights in January and really enjoyed our stay. It's a quirky little place - and it is an older motel that's had a makeover as someone mentioned, but it's been done very well, so why would that matter? The rooms are clean and fresh, the beds are extremely comfortable and the bathrooms have been renovated. They put loads of pillows & cushions and lovely crisp, white cotton sheets on the beds, which we really liked. We were given a corner room, and our family of 5 plus 5 large suitcases fitted easily. Venice Beach is an expensive place to stay, so I think that the rates at the Inn were very reasonable. Venice Beach is a quirky area & I really think that the hotel is well suited to the area. If you're looking for a large international, impersonal hotel, then this isn't the one for you. It's small, comfortable and friendly. Our room was at the back of the hotel & we didn't hear any street noise at all in the 3 nights we were there. My husband & daughter used their little gym & liked it. They also included a very good continental breakfast, with various fresh toasts and pastries, cereals, boiled eggs and a variety of juices, teas & coffee. It's just a short stroll to the beach & boardwalk, or you can stroll through the backstreets towards the boardwalk & see all the lovely houses along the canals. Across the road you can wander to Marina del Rey and look at all the poor people's boats! We would both stay there again & also recommend it to friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “Four out of five ain't to shabby”
Reviews.Author: Montereyblue2
Reviews.Content: Planning a trip to LA for me usually gets me in a cold sweat. There's several reasons for this, trafffic being on the top of the list, choosing an inexpensive, clean and centralized hotel in a large city such as Los Angeles is a close second. I decided to combat the traffic issue by activating my navigation on my Blackberry (Highly recommended and worth the extra bucks). After reseaching a variety of hotels, motels, B & Bs, I settled on the Inns at Venice Beach. My teenage son and I rolled into Venice late on Saturday night and tenitively strolled into the small lobby adjacent to the garage. We received a warm welcome, quick service and directions to a late meal from a pleasent young man at the front desk. As we rode the elevator and walked the mezzanine around the open court yard to our room my son and I to agreed that so far so good, the Inn seemed pleasent enough. While the Inn at Venice is not a four star, four diamond property it is a clean and straight to the point "funky boutique hotel" in a great and safe neighborhood. The beach is a block away, restaurants are plenty and acess to all major highways are less then 10 minutes away (very easy with the help of a good map and or navigator, again highly recommended for us out of towners). The Inn offeres a free, fresh and plentiful continental breakfast and pleasent customer service. My only disappointment was the noise, as mentioned earlier we arrived to the hotel late and the hope of sleeping in was diminished with the noise of early raisers and housekeeping as the rooms don't seem well insulated and sound traveled straight through the walls and through the pillow that covered my head forcing me to start my day at the crack of dawn. Because the hotel is in such a great neighborhood my son and I did not hesitate to grab our sneakers and go for a morning run through the eclectic streets of Venice turning my crumpy, early rise into a very pleasent day... Yes I would recommend the Inn at Venice to everyone I know. Infact as this trip was a college tour trip and my son's top choice of school is right in the heart of LA I predict that I'll be visiting the Inn at Venice again, with ear plugs and sneakers in tow. The price is right, the employees are friendly, the locations is great, and the rooms are clean, four out of 5 ain't to shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location even without a car, nice for Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Susanloveshotels
Reviews.Content: This a cute, non-chain hotel, that is in a good location even without a car. Rooms are nice, bathrooms are sufficient, although the tub/toilet portion is pretty cramped. The front desk clerk could perhaps do a better job of giving you the impression that you are not actually interrupting her personal phone call when you have a question, but will help you with what you need. The owner was very helpful when I got held up on an appointment in Malibu and couldn't make it back right in time for check-out, and allowed me another hour. Breakfast was good, coffee was good, parking was easy, wifi reception was good as well. This hotel is good value for the area, and way more fun than a chain, without the gritty edge of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great price, good value.”
Reviews.Author: TerinaSydney
Reviews.Content: We really liked this place. We had a loft apartment with a queen bed and a queen sofa bed. The queen bed upstairs was really comfortable, the sofa bed was passable and better than many sofa beds around. We had a balcony overlooking the mexican restaurant over the road but weren't disturbed by the noise. The bathroom shower/bath and toilet are in a separate room to the basin and mirror so they can be used separately. All room are around a pretty central courtyard where we had breakfast. A continental breakfast was included for us and consisted of coffee/juice/toast/waffles/muffins/cereal. Staff were extremely helpful giving directions and advice for tourists. Location is at the Marina Del Rey end of Venice Beach, about 5 min walk from the popular part of Venice where you can have a beer and watch the sunset, go to a freak show, buy jewellery you would never actually wear, and wonder at how accessible glaucoma medicine is in California. A short cab ride to go to 3rd St Promenade, Santa Monica for shopping dinner, movies and to hear tomorrow's stars busking; to go to Santa Monica Pier for carnival rides, arcades, a great ocean view and some great street dancers; or to Abbot Kinney Blvd in Venice for shopping (similar to Brunswick St in Melbourne, for the Aussies reading this). A long cab ride (~$50) to Hollywood or Beverly Hills. For a great mexican meal with margaritas, try the Baja Cantina next to the hotel (across the side street), great food and a short walk back to the room.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karey512
Reviews.Content: We are a '20 something' young married couple, who ended up spending a week and a half in Los Angeles, a last minute decision. We were supposed to have taken a cruise, our first cruise, to Mexico, however, ten days before departure, our plans had to change due to the Swine Flu outbreak. We were devistated, having planned this trip for 6 months!! Our plane tickets were to and from Los Angeles, so we decided take this as divine intervention, and embrace the trip of a lifetime, to experience the California dream!! I frantically went all over the internet looking for a hotel that would fit our price range, that was near the beach, and began to feel uneasy, hoping that my last minute choices were the right ones. When I called the Inn to verify my booking, my fears were instantly calmed, as I took immediate comfort in the staff. They listened to my every request, booked many different tours for us, and put me right at ease, allowing me to regain my excitement about my upcoming trip!!! I would especially like to thank Alfonso...the guy who ran the front desk during the day.I could tell that he truly cared about us, asking us about our trip, and making sure we got FREE breakfast!!! Everything about this hotel was amazing- the location cannot be beat- as 20 somethings, we were in the heart of the action of a bazillion restaraunts, the beach was steps away, we even found a bar, Cabo Cantina, that took the edge off the loss of what would have been-going to the 'real' Cabo San Lucas!! Anyways, I would stay here again in a heartbeat, and this truly was a trip of a lifetime, and one of the happiest weeks of my life! ~Karen and Jon

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: global_traveller_888
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in Dec and was a bit hesitant at first when I read the reviews. However I was positively surprised. The location is very good as it is just next to Marina del Rey and three minutes away by foot from Venice Beach. It is on a main road but if you have a room facing away from it, it's fine. Parking is quite convenient as the hotel has it's own self parking facility which costs USD 7 a night which is a good price for that area. The room is quite big and so is the bathroom area. The room is not very modern (i.e. no flat screen TV etc.) but everything is clean and the bed is very comfortable. I had some minor issues with the drainage in the shower and my phone was not working very well. However those are details. Also the WiFi was bit patchy as it kept logging me out. I tried with my iPhone and my laptop and both seemed to have problems. Not sure what the problem was. Breakfast was the typical continental breakfast type with cereals, bagels, hard boiled eggs etc. It was not bad and was served in a small room on the first floor. Check-out was efficient and quick which was appreciated. To sum it up, it's a good hotel and if you can get it for the right price (USD 117 p/night excl tax and parking) it is really good value for money. It is also near LAX and bordering to Santa Monica. The location is probably one of the best assets of this hotel. I shall definitely return to this hotel even if the price is a bit higher.

Reviews.Title: “Motel-style place in good location”
Reviews.Author: Boutiquer
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, comfy bed, convenient $7 parking per day which we hear is decent for the area. Strange Oscar the Grouch green paint colour on some hallway walls. V. good location just a 5 min walk to Venice Beach gong show. Watch out for the Shea Butter Man. That guys is a classic. Hotel location is right on Washington, so you can hear a bit of traffic, but it's way quieter than staying in one of the places on the beach stroll. Hotel website calls breakfast "deluxe continental" (bagels, boiled eggs, packaged oatmeal cereal, apples, bread, packaged muffins) which is a stretch and the cutlery is plastic disposable much like other US places in the same budget - why? What does it take to thow some silverware in the dishwasher - just saying. Request a room on the 3rd floor (top floor) above the courtyard as the ceilings are higher.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PerryQuad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a layover from after our cruise to before we left the next day. It is within walking distance to the beach and a skateboard park. It is a 45 minute walk to the famous Santa Monica Pier, but we did not attempt it. There is a Starbucks within one block and across the street there is a nice, reasonably priced family restaurant. The room was very spacious and very clean. The front desk staff was exceptionally helpful and willing to answer any questions that we had. The arranged for a cab to pick us up the next morning in order to get to the airport. The cab fare from this motel to the LAX was approximately $25.00. There were complimentary water bottles in our room and a small fridge. Yes, there is some 'traffic noise'; however, we closed the windows, turned on the fan and were quite comfortable. The free breakfast consisted of cereal, toast, bagels, and eggs along with coffee, tea, hot chocolate and water for porridge.

Reviews.Title: “A tad noisy but overall a good value”
Reviews.Author: S&L_from_MA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night. After reading earlier reviews, I specifically requested a quiet room. Our 2nd floor room had a sliding door overlooking a Mexican restaurant and even though we were near the rear of the premises, there was quite a bit of road noise (if you prefer fresh air, as we do). The room was clean (a few carpet stains), the bedding comfortable, and the staff was very courteous and helpful. A problem with our TV remote was handled quickly. Check in/out was flawless. The bathroom has an awkward set up with toilet/tub/door. Okay for one night, but much longer and I think it would drive you nuts. The breakfast was better than anticipated and the little cafÃ© was very clean. The courtyard looked pleasant but since it was pouring rain, we were unable to use it. The Inn is a very easy drive to the airport â€“ no highways! And itâ€™s an economical and convenient choice to and from Universal Studios and Hollywood. We would stay there again for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “too loud”
Reviews.Author: Gilanah
Reviews.Content: I'd stay here if I could be guaranteed a room facing the courtyard, as the staff was lovely and the location was good. But my first-floor room onto the main street had significant noise problems: no sound-proofing on the sliding glass door, drippy a/c, car alarm, etc. Breakfast was good: hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, cereal, and so on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and staff -you can't really go wrong here”
Reviews.Author: LondonTreepixie
Reviews.Content: We were only here for one night but it was a good place to start. The staff couldn't have been more helpful - even finding us future hotels to stay at on our roadtrip. It's a shame they have covered all the walls in this icky artex stuff - it's a crime against design but you get used to it. The breakfast was the best buffet we got - simple straightforward and tasty and the patio area in which to eat it very tranquil and pretty. The location was perfect - next door to the best local Mexican and 5 mins from the beach. The room was a bit old but clean, spacious and comfortable - a good deal for the prce.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, staff and room”
Reviews.Author: Yossarian101
Reviews.Content: I simply can't fault this place. The staff were friendly and helpful from the moment we parked. We got a loft room and it was cool - I liked the layout, it was big and ridiculously good value. Great location a stones throw from Venice Beach, cool bars and at least one fantastic Mexican Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “awesome beds,service,location and area!!!”
Reviews.Author: thuff32
Reviews.Content: We totally enjoyed the beautiful view from our room and the great courteous help we recieved from the desk staff, especially Courtney. Our beds were awesome and so was the continental breakfast that was served each day. The cookies warm from the oven and fresh coffee in the afternoon was a pleasant bonus. I will stay there from now on we we visit Southern California!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B in wonderful Venice Beach.”
Reviews.Author: Cintrus
Reviews.Content: I guess one of the hints that you are staying in a quality looking hotel, motel or b&b was indicated when we came back from a tour to Universal Studios and 3/4 of the tour leaned over to the kerbside window and said ''Wow - is that where you guys are staying...it looks fantastic!!'' The hotel looks great with a nicely decorated lobby area and friendly staff (Alfonso) who, when we arrived organised our room and answered all our questions about what to see, do and eat, and booked our tours for the next two days. The rooms are well appointed. We had a king bed room with balcony. Although the balcony faced the outside car park area - we never used it as we were mostly walking our way along the beachfront or walking to the Abbot Kinney Blvd shops, eating, sleeping or on tours. There is high speed internet at this hotel which worked fine. The hotel/B&B is located about 200m from the beach foreshore on Washington Boulevard. There are a number of restaurant nearby ranging from Italian, Mexican, Cuban and SoCal food. Venice Beach brings characters to your holiday and not the kind that I would stand next to at a Theme park. So if people watching is your thing - stay in Venice Beach. If not Santa Monica may be better suited. We walked from Venice Beach to Santa Monica pier on a number of occasions. If you walked with a purpose it probably would take you 40 minutes. But when you have so much to see - take your time and take it all in as you wont see many places in the world like the Venice Beach foreshore walk. We loved The Inn at Venice. The rooms were nice, breakfast was adequate with bagels, cereals, juices, coffee, tea and all that goes along with a self service breakfast. It was all tasty and fresh. Breakfast is served on the first floor with an option to eat in the courtyard. All in all our stay at the Inn at Venice was really great. Good friendly staff, nice rooms, good healthy breakfasts and a great location made our stay in Venice Beach a memorable one. So much so that we really cant wait to return one day....and if we did we would stay nowhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Pixie15
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Inn at Venice Beach. We booked a 2 queen room for $169/night. When we arrived early, our room wasnâ€™t ready, but front desk staff were very accommodating & locked our luggage while we strolled Venice Beach for a few hours. The hotel is conveniently located on Washington Blvd., within walking distance of restaurants, a grocery store on the corner, Starbucks, bike rentals, etc. I was pleasantly surprised the hotel is a few blocks from the Venice canals. Strolling the canals and admiring the beautiful homes was a treat. We had a huge 2-queen room, with a small fridge, safe, flat-screen TV, and a little balcony. The gym is a small room next to the lobby with a TV, 1 bike, 1 treadmill and weights. And the free internet was 1 computer in the lobby. The courtyard was very quaint, and while the complimentary breakfast in the courtyard didnâ€™t serve hot food (just the muffins, bagels, hard-boiled eggs, cereal, whole fruit, etc.) it was more than sufficient. Iâ€™d definitely stay again and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: PtichkaAga
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its price and location. I brought my husband ans a 2-year old for a 6-day vacation. We had a wonderful time, and hotel stuff helped us a lot. They provided everything to make our stay with the kid comfortable, they were giving us information about the area, they were extremely friendly and professional. The room was very clean and nice, the breakfast was very good, too. The hotel itself is located at the great area, 3 minutes from the ocean, 6 minutes from Venice beach, and 3 minutes from the best Italian restaurant in LA. Also, in hotel, you can ask for different tours to attractions, museums, etc, and hotel stuff will help you to arrange this. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value!”
Reviews.Author: mmshimizu
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our short stay here. The location is great, right next to the Baja Cantina, the Venice Canals and Venice Beach. Room was very clean and quiet and big.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, small hotel- nice change from all the big name places.”
Reviews.Author: bumpin96monte
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel due to its proximity to the beach (although we never made it to Venice Beach as we were only at this hotel for two nights). First looking into it, it is fairly small hotel right off a fairly busy street; we were used to staying in bigger name hotels with tons of rooms, so we were a little weary at first. I must say, this had to be the best hotel we stayed at on our trip. It was a nice relaxing place, and very clean. The only real problem we had was our hair dryer broke- but we had a maintenance guy there with a new one in hand in under 5 minutes, we were very pleased. Pro's: -Very clean rooms -Beautiful center courtyard open to sun (many rooms overlook it) -Free breakfast (small, but it had a lot of choices, and was the only free breakfast we had out of any of the hotels we stayed at) -A couple of the front desk people are extremely helpful (the others are friendly, just not as knowledgeable) -Quite a few local restaurants in close walking distance Con's: -Parking was kindof tricky, their covered parking is only like 8-10 normal spots + a couple handicap; they do have an extra open lot next to it though, and there always seemed to be plenty of parking -Looking at the room, it seemed a pinch smaller than normal- maybe it was just the layout?

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: gangsterwhitewalls
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon here for eight days and had a lovely time.Great base to explore Los Angeles and the surrounding area.Clean,well decorated and very friendly staff.Nice touches like breakfast courtyard area,mountain bike hire and parking facilities.Front desk extremeley helpful with advice and bookings.Nice Mexican restaurant next door and Marathon car rental office a mile up the road.Hope to return to California next year for longer.Definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Venice Beach!”
Reviews.Author: klmsailorgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights in early May 2009 and really enjoyed this place. Great location - walk to beach and restaurants and very easy access to LAX, too. Parking was easy and hotel staff was friendly - hot chocolate chip cookies in the afternoon were a treat. A car is definitely recommended if you are visiting Los Angeles for the first time - lots of driving to get to different neighborhoods, towns, areas. Rooms were colorful and clean , beds were very comfortable, and courtyard in the middle was a nice spot to grab breakfast (continental breakfast included in room price). This was my first trip to L.A., and while the city is not my cup of tea, this hotel was a nice place to come back to after a day of sightseeing. Being near the water and the beach is definitely a way to recapture your sanity in crazy southern California! I would stay at this hotel again in a hearbeat were I to return to L.A. - a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - helpful desk staff”
Reviews.Author: mcrus
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the location both from an accessibility to the beach and good restaurants and a convenient place from which to get around. Front desk was very helpful and friendly. Only complaint was inadequate drainage from bath/shower. This was reported twice but not attended to. Parking in the reserved spaces was convenient and very reasonable. Rooms were clean and reasonably sized. Breakfast , although not cooked, was rather more than the advertised continental and was excellent .

Reviews.Title: “second visit - perfect again!”
Reviews.Author: happydaysManchester
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to the hotel and it was every bit as good as our first stay! I love the location - a block from the quieter end of Venice Beach, good size rooms, balcony, air conditioning (individual), and a complementary breakfast. All the staff we dealt with were really friendly and helped out with recommendations of things to see / do...nothing was too much trouble! I would def recommened this hotel to others

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel; unexpectedly good location”
Reviews.Author: Jolobean
Reviews.Content: What criteria do you use to describe the location of a hotel in LA? If like us you were taking the children to Disneyland or Hollywood (both an hours drive away - in good traffic!) then Venice Beach isn't the natural choice. Also whilst the hotel is definitely "at" Venice beach it isn't "on" the beach, albeit it's just 5 mins walk away. But the hotel deserves to be recommended for it's location because Venice, the local restaurants, the beach/pier and the canals which start a block behind the hotel were completely unexpected. What had started as an exercise in cost control ended up making us re-appraise (for the better) our previously rather uninformed view of LA. The hotel was easy to find and benefited from on-site parking at a small additional charge. It appeared to have been recently re-decorated, the beds were comfortable and the shower good. Everything was clean. Like all of the hotels we stayed in at this price bracket the walls were thin and at other times of the year it might have been noisy but during our stay there was nothing too bad. The receptionists were friendly if a little prone to offer very expensive tour options.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good (but very basic) for the price. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Lauren54321
Reviews.Content: This place is good if you want to stay in a renovated, clean place near the beach, but aren't looking for too much more than that. Our room was a bit small, but sufficient. Nothing extraordinary about this place, but there is so much to do in the area, it doesn't matter. They aren't many amenities (no pool, cafe, hot breakfast, lounge). Although they do have fresh cookies at the front desk in the afternoons and HBO. Within a block you will find many restaurants, including a few that are really excellent. The beach and pier are very close. You should be able to get a room there for around $150/night. If you are willing to spend a little more, you can get a better place with some amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Winchkate
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely with a nice relaxed feeling. Complimentary WIFI available in the rooms. Clean, comfortable, modern rooms. Breakfast was included in the rate and there was seating in the lovely courtyard. You must remember to be around reception at about 3pm as there are free cookies which are fabulous but they go quickly. Most of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful but there was one lady was was quite rude and dismissive. Location was great - 5 minute walk to Venice Beach. There is ample parking but you like most hotels in Califiornia you do have to pay - around $7 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small place close to the Venice pier”
Reviews.Author: b-noy
Reviews.Content: First of all, I arrived at the hostel without having any plans during my stay. The guy at the office help me with that told me what to do and where to go. The service was perfect and the room was a nice small room. The location is perfect: 3 to 5 minutes of walking throught the Venice pier and the beach. The breakfast is included, a great way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay every time we're in LA”
Reviews.Author: AliceInDownUnderLand
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed both times we stayed at the Inn recently. It has big rooms, a beautiful and quiet courtyard, and extremely helpful and polite staff. In particular, one staff member went out of her way to help me with an urgent internet problem, which was just outstanding service. We were also helped with baggage storage and they dealt with early/late checkouts without any issue. The facilities (including free internet, gym, and breakfast) are great for the price, and it was a very convenient location too! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FrankieOreo
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here and had a wonderful time during our stay. We were greeted at check-in with a smile and warm cookies that just came out of the oven. The room was clean, quiet, and of nice size with a comfortable bed. The complimentary breakfast is a very nice touch which we took advantage of both days. This hotel is in a great location, just a couple of blocks from the beach. You cannot beat the price for what you receive.

Reviews.Title: “A Sound Choice”
Reviews.Author: benny01720
Reviews.Content: Located just a short walk from the funky, fun Venice Beach with tons of volleyball courts and head shops, the Inn at Venice Beach was a very pleasant and fairly economical place to base one's LA/Santa Monica operations. I was there for a wedding in Santa Monica and stayed four nights. The room was clean, spacious and brightly decorated. It also had a small balcony overlooking busy Washington Blvd. Too bad it's on a bus line. Traffice noise (and construction cacaphony from a new building in progress right across the street) meant that keeping the slider open during the day was impossible if you wanted to think or watch TV. Of course, neither is why one comes to CA, so get out and enjoy the local ambience. Great restaurants nearby as well. The Inn offers a continental breakfast each morning. Nothing special to eat, but the setting made you feel like you were in a small European hotel: a tiled courtyard, open to the sky, water fountain....nice, nice, nice. The staff I encountered were warm and welcoming. Never made it to the workout room. Don't expect a lobby in which to lounge, it is small, but, again, nicely decorated. Go eat, sit and read the complimentary USA Today you will get delivered to your door. I would definitely stay there again, but probably request a room on the inner courtyard rather than Washington Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Mod_esty61
Reviews.Content: We stayed almost a week at Venice Inn end of October. Hotel was very cosy, we liked the staff and were happy about breakfast. The short distance to SM and LAX were the reasons to choose it at the first place, and of course the nearness to the beach. It was also nice to walk to Fishermans Village and admire boats at Marina del Rey. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: fer1219
Reviews.Content: This place was VERY clean, staff was very accomodating and willing to help us book any tours. Receptionist reccommeded different tours and eateries for us. Awesome breakfast served every morning, where you can eat in an outdoor courtyard. 5 girls in one room, where the hotel provided an excellent roll-away cot and always gave us plenty of towels!! Conveniently located to the beach and Baja Cantina next door was EXCELLENT!!! Balconies were awesome. The only compaint was there was no parking one night, but the front desk attendent quickly aleviated any problem. Will defintely stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The location is its strengh”
Reviews.Author: sgbslo
Reviews.Content: We have family in the area so have stayed in quite a few of the local places. This was our first visit to the Inn at Venice Beach. We were hoping it would be a little more like an "inn" than a generic place but while we had no major problems with the place, it was just about as generic as staying at any of the mid-range chains. Our room was an okay size and very clean. There was a tiny balcony overlooking a side street which was fine. The bathroom was very small but clean. Our sink did make some odd noises at various times when it wasn't even in use. We told them about this at check-out, so hopefully it will be fixed. They offer a continental breakfast which was almost exactly what you'd find at any of the chains. It would have been nice if they'd had a bowl of cut up fruit instead of just a few whole pieces. There is a little courtyard area where you can eat and that was pleasant. I would stay there again if the rate was good but I didn't feel it was worth any extra money.

Reviews.Title: “What Customer Service is All About”
Reviews.Author: LA_Love
Reviews.Content: My family and I wanted to hang out at the beach for a weekend, so a friend recomended this Hotel. I called the the Hotel directly and spoke with Maggie who as very pleasant and informative. She really listened to what I was looking for and made many suggestions on points of interest for Vencie and Marina del Rey, so naturally I booked. Upon our arrival we were greeted by Alfonso (very pleasant) and Maggie (whom I come to find is the Hotel GM) shown to our immaculately clean and vibrant room. During out 2 night stay the entire staff was extremly helpful and accomodating, they truly know what customer service is all about I highly recommend this Hotel to both local and foregin travelers. The rooms are colorful and charming, the staff is friendly and personable, and the location is unbeatable! Definately on my list of favorites!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Venice Beach area”
Reviews.Author: BillericayBaz
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful reception staff. Couldn't be in a better location for Venice Beach - less than 100m from the beach and the boardwalk. Breakfast area was very busy but adequate Room was very comfortable. Bit more expensive than other hotels on our trip but the premium price is for the location

Reviews.Title: “Pricey for room size”
Reviews.Author: LizRLondon
