Reviews.Content: Well decorated and handy for Venice Beach. Seemed expensive compared with other hotels on our trip ( but maybe that is down to the proximity to venice beach). Loft room not very big but we still failed to locate the air conditioner (behind a table) so felt very hot all night! Check in staff very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: travelviking
Reviews.Content: Pro: Room divided in two storeys (good for families) Very spacious Good breakfast included - in pleasant courtyard 5 minute walk from the Venice Pier Good restaurants neighboor the inn (thai+mexi) Parking Con: No pool Sum-up: Great for families - good value

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ghost
Reviews.Content: Venice Beach was fun and the hotel is very convenient to just about everything. The room was comfortable and nice appointed. Drawbacks--toilet tank would not refill after flushing. Management was expeditious in repairing problem. However their solution caused a different problem which prevented toilet tank from filling after it was flushed. Hotel provided a complimentary breakfast which seemed paltry for the prices they charge for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: TravlinLarry
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Inn at Venice Beach in July of '08. It was our first time to stay in this part of LA, and we are from out of state. The hotel is well maintained and the staff was great. Front desk was very helpful in providing directions, booking a tour, and making sure our stay was going well. The room was large, but could use some additional horizontal surfaces in the large bathroom (just a small table would have helped). The hotel has a central, small courtyard which is used for the free breakfast each morning. It's really nice to sit out and enjoy a cup of coffee. However, if you are a late riser, I would suggest you stay on one of the upper floors as the courtyard noises might wake you up earlier than you want. There is a limited amount of covered parking available at the property. This was great as it kept our car out of the sun. Finally, this property is located on the far south end of Venice Beach. The water is only about 200 yards from the lobby. There's a great pier right at the end of the road on which the hotel is located. However, It's a 10-15 minute walk up the beach to get to where the 'action' is (street vendors, buskers, muscle beach). I would definitely stay at the Inn at Venice Beach again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chappaqua_travelers
Reviews.Content: We spent two wonderful days at the Inn at Venice Beach (a little bit of a misnomer, since it is really on the edge of Marina del Rey, which is a good thing). Our room was nicely laid out, quiet (we faced the back) and absolutely spotless. The entire staff was friendly and welcoming. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance, and the beach is only a couple of blocks away. Breakfast is fine, the inside courtyard/ patio is fabulous and peaceful. We recommend the Inn highly, and we will be back the next time we're in LA.

Reviews.Title: “As Advertised”
Reviews.Author: Irwish
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, plenty of food and shopping within walking distance, and a very nice overall property. I had a nice room overlooking the patio area. The room was bright and cheerful which went along with the hotel staff who were a nice change from some places I have stayed at in the LA area. The breakfast offered was nice but would not call it "sumptuous" as noted on their web site. My meetings were in Malibu, so staying in Venice Beach did add about 15 minutes to my drive, in rush hour vs staying in Santa Monica. The differance this grade of room would have been a minimum of $50.00 more not counting breakfast. My only complaint is the $7.00 parking fee that's charged. Although this is $18.00 or so cheaper than any Santa Monica Hotel I still feel parking should be included in the cost of a room that costs north of $150.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buzz73
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights from the 10th to 17th of April. The hotel is in an excellent location for enjoying the beaches at Venice / Santa Monica or to use as a base for exploring LA. The hotel is faultless, cheap parking, very clean, endless free coffee at reception, quality rooms etc. The best aspect of the hotel is the staff, the friendliness and helpfulness of the reception staff is second to none. Would recommend to anyone and would certainly return if / when I visit LA again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette_8
Reviews.Content: We booked on-line and arrived to find the hotel met all our expectations. Comfortable room, very friendly staff happy to go the extra mile. Nice fresh biscuits at afternoon tea and fresh fruit as well. Great location....just a short walk to beach; not far from Marina Del Ray. Breakfast isn't amazing but there's certainly plenty of it with a lovely courtyard to sit in. All in all, we were pleased. We'd come off a 121/2 hour flight, and it was everything we needed to get a quick taste of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: nursenancy03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn last month and were pleasantly surprised. It is clean and comfy, with lots of nice extra touches. Real plants in the rooms, robes, free bottled water and nice toiletries. Very clean bathrooms. The rooms are spacious, bright and cheerful. Continental breakfast was excellent! One of the best I've seen. The Inn is only a short two block walk to the Pier at Venice Beach and the Venice Canals are only a block away. There are restaurants nearby. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The Inn is on a busy street and there is construction nearby so it might be a good idea to bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper. All things considered this is a great hotel for the money!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West Coast National Park, South Africa
Reviews.Title: “Still great”
Reviews.Author: MsAudubon
Reviews.Content: We've come before and we just reserved to return in April. A couple of blocks to good restaurants and the Venice boardwalk. Staff are always very professional and friendly. They have wi-fi now, and are almost finished some renovations. Clean, convenient, and priced for those of us who like small hotels but have small budgets too. Little details like cookies and fruit at the desk. Breakfast has many choices, and can be eaten in the outdoor Atrium on warm days. They charge $4 a day additional for parking, but that's minor compared to others in this area.

Reviews.Title: “loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasLemming
Reviews.Content: Yes, there was renovations going on while I was there. And I used to live in LA, so I didn't need any resources the average tourist might need. But the location, the amenities, the price - all combined made it a fantastic bargain. 3 Blocks from the beach (1 block from the canals), close to the airport, easy to get on the 405, easy to get onto Lincoln Blvd (and to Santa Monica), plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. It may not be for everybody, but it was perfect for me. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: annbg
Reviews.Content: We booked a 5 night stay about two months before traveling, when we were assured that we would receive the room of our choice, a king bedroom off the street. Our first disappointment occurred at arrival when we learned that the hotel was undergoing a renovation and so this type of room was not available. The only king bedrooms faced a noisy major street, so we accepted a queen bedroom. This room was on the ground floor and had no privacy as it faced an inner courtyard. Not great, but livable. The second night of our stay, though, we came back to the hotel late at night to find that they'd been painting the courtyard during the day. Our room was filled with paint fumes and completely sealed with plastic over the only windows! We could not sleep in the room and ended up in, yes, a noisy king bedroom facing the street. Needless to say the next morning we checked out and found another place to stay (the very lovely Inn at Playa del Rey). The front desk manager was barely apologetic, explaining that well, they had to do their renovation sometime, so it was pretty much our tough luck that we scheduled our trip at this time. And this at $180 per night! Don't stay at this hotel if you expect hospitable service. We would never consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably not again...”
Reviews.Author: Emma1975
Reviews.Content: After vowing never to stay at the Inn again, we decided to give the hotel one more chance. We were travelling with my family in February and we decided to stay at the Inn for 2 nights before heading to Vegas. The previous 3 nights were spent in Anaheim at a fairly new hotel so that had set the bench mark. Upon arrival at the Inn our rooms were not ready (as usual) so we stored our bags and went out for the day. We returned back and checked-in. I think we were given the oldest, most rundown rooms in the place. We were on the top level in rooms 316, 317 and 318 I think? Our room, 316 was so old and musty. The heating didn't work, the toilet leaked, it was very noisy. We had to have someone come to our room at 10pm at night and spend an hour to try and fix our toilet. We then had to have someone come back and try and fix our heating - which was never fixed properly. The rooms are very run down and are extremely noisy. I could hear my dad in the next room when he took a shower or went to the bathroom. The noise from the fountain in the courtyard is OK during the day, but at night it becomes a bit annoying (they do turn it off, but not until late). On a positive note, the location is sensational and the walk to Santa Monica is great. The breakfast the Inn provides is adequate and they don't mind if you take some snacks with you for the day. The staff are wonderful, they are always helpful and greet you every time you come back to the hotel. We won't stay at the Inn again, however we would recommend this hotel to budget travellers who only need a place to lay their heads.

Reviews.Title: “go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Jeff'swife
Reviews.Content: I agree about the excellent location and what other review mentioned. Although the staff is friendly however useless. It's their financial benefit (commissions and tips) to advise travelers on excursions and trips. They were not knowedgeable or helpful. ie there is a boat trip to Catalina from nearby Marina Del Ray. I wanted them to book it for me. They said there was no such of a trip. They wanted to send me to Long Beach. Another example, I told them to book a Spa treatment at the the one they're associated with called reative Chakra Spa(which btw is fabulous). They screw that one up as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: krram
Reviews.Content: As with other reviewers, I found this hotel to be a great bargain. The rooms are a little bit run down, but very clean. The staff was very friendly, and the free breakfast and cheap parking were both perks. The location really cannot be beat. It's not right on the beach, but it takes 2 minutes to walk there. We found this hotel to be well worth the money, and would definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Inn at Venice Beach - a really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: oxfordmike
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Inn at Venice Beach for four nights. Got there straight from a 12 hour flight and initially the outside looked distinctly down-market and it seemed to be on a major road rather than being "on the beach". However very nice friendly welcome and pleasant quiet room started to make us think it was not so bad. Then found that the "major road" was only 100 yards from a dead end at Venice Beach where there was a cluster of great bars and restaurants. Next morning had an excellent relaxed continental breakfast that had everything we wanted, went for a fantastic walk down the Venice Canal (only a few paces from the hotel) and back down the beach). The hotel is odd in that each part - room, location, breakfast, staff is a bit ordinary but the sum of them produces a really nice place to stay in

Reviews.Title: “I recommend Inn at Venice Beach.”
Reviews.Author: MZ_308
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn at Venice Beach for business. You cannot beat the location, and it is a great value - even the parking. Rooms are clean but a bit dated in decor. The beautiful courtyard and included breakfast more than make up for this, however.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: NewNewPlace
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave us everything we needed. It's in a great location, close to the beach, walking distance to Marina del Rey, and to the Venice canals. The wifi was great, the room was big enough, and there were bathrobes in the closet and decent shampoo and soap samples. The (included) breakfast had just about any cold item you might normally have: bagels, cereals, yogurt, cold hard-boiled eggs, and fruit. The lobby always had apples, coffee, lemonade, and sometimes cookies. For the price, we couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: john_from_uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Nov 2007 for 5 nights. Just 2 minutes walk to Venice beach, & then a 3-mile walk or cycle along the beach to Santa Monica, so good location. Very friendly reception staff. Room not too big but adequate for my needs. There's an attractive-looking central courtyard which is where you go for breakfast - breakfast was very average, not a great choice of food & I don't think there were many or any healthy options. Car park at the back (only found out when I was checking out that they were charging me for the use of the car park - I had been under the impression that it was free to use for hotel guests). Overall, a good hotel, good place to use as a base for exploring LA, & I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nzgirl74
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. The location was perfect! A short walk to the Venice Beach boardwalk and plenty of restaurants, bars etc. Considering where it was it was very quiet too. We had a rental car and parking was provided for just $4 per day. The room was a good size and very clean and tidy, we had a small balcony. The breakfast was good for a free breakfast. I can highly recommend the Baja Cantina next door for a great Mexican meal and margaritas! Overall a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Inn at Venice Beach in October of 07 during our 2 week vacation starting in San Francisco heading for San Diego. We really enjoyed our stay here. We wanted to see LA but did not want to stay in the city, we are beachbums at heart. We were impressed with the room and love the layout of the hotel with the inner courtyard area. And it is always nice to have a little breakfast in the morning The hotel is within walking distance to Venice Beach & also some very fine restaurants. It was a welcome place to come back to after sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaC
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a property near LAX, only 7 minutes away and compared to the LAX airport high rises this was a steal. From the welcoming reception, cookies and apples in the lobby, upscale furniture and the cutest open courtyard with bistro sets this hotel does it right. The decor in the room, fluffy towels, above average bathroom accessories and a fridge, bottled water is everything you need. Great location from the pier and no problems at all with noise. Stay here and treat yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel great, beach shabby”
Reviews.Author: CaptainL-RI
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our one night stay at this very nice inn. It was very easy to find, and the location is 2 blocks (an easy walk) from the beach. The greeting we received from the front desk was welcoming and made us feel like they were really glad to have us. What a personality he has!! Even gave us his own cookies when we were looking for the homemade cookies in the lobby after our excursion to the beach that night and they were gone! A good variety of restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel & great staff”
Reviews.Author: MariaSteve S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to spend a few days in LA to break up the journey back to the UK following a cruise we had taken. We chose the Inn at venice beach for its location and the reviews we had read on this site. We were not disappointed. On arrival by taxi from LAX, and a little weary following a long night flight, we were greeted with a very warm welcome from the chap at the front desk. His name was Emad. A special thankyou to him for making our stay so enjoyable. He recommended lovely places to eat, advised us on trips and generally organised everything we required. First class. The location was everything we had hoped for, 150m from the pier and with plenty of resturants to choose from catering for all tastes. We arrived on a Sunday morning and decided to take a stroll down to Santa Monica. It took a couple of hours but we were bemused the whole way by the many street entertainers. The hotel is a jem. Very clean, has a nice courtyard were you can have your complimentary breakfast and also provides free speciality coffee, fruit juice, cookies and fruit in the reception area. Our first time in LA and we will go back and definitly stay at the Inn at Venice Beach.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and sweat”
Reviews.Author: koiko
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel. clean. lovely location. friendly staff. price value over average. recommend for all. clean and tidy and sweat rooms

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chloejoy
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, clean small hotel close to Venice Pier and the quieter, residential south end of Venice Beach. The staff is very helpful and the room I had was clean and nicely decorated. Complimentary shampoo, conditioner, lotion, shower cap and a hair dryer are in the room. I was on the 2nd floor on the side street and had minimal problems with the construction site located across Washington Blvd. There was some noise from the Mexican restaurant located across Sanborn Avenue, but it was tolerable (plus I bring ear plugs when traveling, so that helps with any noise). The breakfast (included in room rate) was wonderful and includes hard boiled eggs and fresh fruit. There are small refrigerators in the rooms, so food can be stored there to eat at another time. There are also many restaurants in the area (including an Italian restaurant that delivers), particularly near the beach and Venice Pier. The hotel parking lot was easy to access and reasonably priced. There's an inexpensive place to rent bikes near the beach on Washington Blvd. The rate for the day was $18.00 and there are also hourly rates (bring a picture ID, which must be left until the bike is returned). Bikes can be ridden to Main Street and Abbot Kinney Blvd. for shopping, where they can be locked up outside the shops (bikes have locks and baskets to keep your purchases in). The hotel's website has special deals and I booked my room that way for a 4 night stay. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & close to beach”
Reviews.Author: MinamiRinkan
Reviews.Content: Small, older hotel a 5 minute walk from the beach and boardwalk. Nicely updated with considerate touches (robes and gourmet coffee). Friendly and helpful staff. New Orleans-style courtyard looks authentic, with continental breakfast there every morning. Good restaurants nearby. Easy onsite parking. Free wifi. No noise problem experienced on the 3rd floor, rear of building. Lockbox wasn't working, which was a major inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location (but with lots of noise)”
Reviews.Author: anzac1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, really close to the beach and the pier. You can walk to muscle beach in about 10 minutes. There are bike hire places really close which is a good option to cover more distance. If you're tight on budget there are public buses from outside the hotel that can take you to LAX for $1.50 (much cheaper than any taxi, shuttle etc), the ride takes about 30-40mins. Breakfast was supplied and there was a good selection. Available were waffles, cereal, toast, bagels, fruit, yoghurt, coffee, hot chocolate to name a few items. Don't stay on the main road side of the building though. There is a multi-level construction site opposite the hotel and they start with the jack hammers at 7.30am!!! This is the only negative to this hotel. If you can't get a room away from the construction site, then I'd suggest stay elsewhere if you want to sleep in past 7.30am. I'd guess there is a few months of building work to go yet. Overall, this is a plesant hotel to stay in. Clean with helpful staff and a good continental breakfast. I'd recommend a stay here as long as you weren't opposite the construction site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at the Beach”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveller40
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in May at this small hotel two blocks from the beach on the "less commercial" end of Venice Beach. Large rooms with refrigerator and coffee maker; continental breakfast; cookies and coffee or juice in the lobby each afternoon and excellent rates. The front desk staff were very helpful with suggestions for local restaurants and driving directions. Hotel is only a few miles from the 405, so if you want to visit places up and down the coast, you can be on the Interstate quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Place”
Reviews.Author: rlkenny
Reviews.Content: Cute Place...clean..location is great..close to nice dining and the beach...one suggestion..stay on the third floor....we were on the second floor and the guests above us were really loud...so loud we did not sleep. We had to complain three times. Did not seem like the manager on duty did much. The noise continued all night. Otherwise okay place to stay. Probably will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: porjotok_Boston
Reviews.Content: Pros: My wife and I stayed here during our visit to LA and had a very good time. The staff was friendly and helpful, our room had as good a view as possible from a 4-story building, but the best perk is the location. The proximity to the beach and nice eating places was really convenient (the French cafe a block away was quite good). The complementary breakfast at the courtyard, and Internet, and the cheap parking ($4) were also great. Cons: The room size was okay, it was sunny and painted bright, but the bath was small and cramped. Also, the room rates (we paid $200/night) were a little high in my opinion, given the amenities. Overall: Very positive experience, but a little too expensive. Would definitely consider this next time we're in west LA, but would look around first for some other alternatives as well.

Reviews.Title: “Inn at Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: newpal15
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous trip to the Los Angeles area! We took in just about everything available - even went to the Red Carpet Premier of Shrek 3!! Anyway, Inn at Venice Beach was a very nice, clean and friendly hotel! Four of us stayed in one room but it was not crowded at all. They have a really good continental breakfast every morning which helped us get an earlier start to our trip. It's only two blocks from Venice Beach and there are some very good restaurants in the area. I would highly recommend this hotel. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: aussie_amber
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel as a place to recover after a flight from Australia to LA. We also stayed again for 2 nights at the end of our trip. It was close to the airport and only a quick 15minute drive. The staff were very nice and allowed us to check in early at 11am. We got the same room both stays and the room was cold and smelt like cigarette smoke which I thought was unusual for a non-smoking room. The free breakfast and free wireless internet were great. They don't have any room service or restaurants here but head away from the beach for one block and you'll find an amazing italian restaurant with the yummiest garlic bread. It's only 2 blocks away from the beach and was a really good spot to stay so we could skate along the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience at the Inn at Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMelanie
Reviews.Content: It is hard to believe how rudely and disrespectfully we were treated by the front desk clerk at the Inn at Venice Beach. We are positive people, travel lots for business and pleasure, hate to complain AND have never experienced anything quite like this. For the first time, the previous tripadvisor reviews (we trust in) did not reflect what we saw and experienced first hand - mean spirited staff, noisy high-traffic location, and a shabby, tired hotel. For the last night of a dreamy 9 day California adventure with our children, this was a horrible and ugly disappointment for all of us. We will never be back to the Inn at Venice Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall”
Reviews.Author: oceaniaguy
Reviews.Content: I was stopping in LA for 2 nights when flying from London to Australia on Air NZ, an airline I recommend. After reading the reviews I requested a room by the courtyard because I primarily was stopping in LA to sleep and wanted the quiet. I was not disappointed. I'd asked for a "1 QUEEN BED", non-smoking, and wrote on the booking form that I would be getting in between 8 and 10pm. The nights were nice and quiet. And because I was suffering jet lag I woke early, which was good, because the courtyard gets noisy around 7-8am when people enter it to have the free help-yourself breakfast. An impressively strong yet soft shower was a delight. The front staff were polite and helpful, all three that I encountered during my 2 night stay there. Free newspaper.. great way to start the morning! And cable TV (yay CNBC - I love visiting the USA just for the Cramer Mad Money show that isn't aired anywhere else in the world). At LAX airport I was directed to Super Shuttle who would take me there for $17 (add another $3 for tip, so make it $20). Trouble is, I forgot the address, and no one there heard of "The Inn At Venice Beach". When you print out a booking slip from Expedia it doesn't contain the motel address, so look twice at what you print out before you head to LAX! Proximity on Washington Boulevard from the beach is delightfully close, just a block away! Then turn right at the beach and a block later you're at Venice beach! Delightful. Wow, groups of girls in bikinis on a weekday in March now and then! Great stuff. If you head the other way on Washington Boulevard, then a block away is a selection of cafes and corner stores. As you near the beach on Washington Boulevard there's a small sports store and I bought some Nike sneakers (runners) for US$90 - half the price they are available for in Australia. Last thing - in California there is SALES TAX. And they don't tell you about it, even when they quote prices to you! It's whacked on top. One minute you think you're paying US$2.50 for a hot dog and the next you think they said the total cost wrong (it's sales tax). There's no sales tax refund program when leaving LAX. Just to warn international travellers who aren't used to being lied to when quoted prices.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but overpriced and noisy”
Reviews.Author: GermanExplorer
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the excellent recommendations at Tripadvisor. We stayed one night and our overall impression was that the place is somewhat overrated. We got a room on the road side and it was terrible noisy. Also, there is a building site vis-Ã -vis the hotel and they started working early in the morning. The price we paid for our room was definitely too much due to these circumstances - not very good value for money. If you are going to stay here, ask for a room to the inner courtyard. However, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the complimentary breakfast was very good. There is also a very good french restaurant nearby and the beach is close.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: PriscillaBeachGuy
Reviews.Content: We chose this property for its proximity to the beach and because it looked a little funky. We were pleased with what we discovered here. Situated at the southern end of Venice Beach, the Inn is located near a lot of restaurant choices and away from the craziness of the ocean front walk. The rooms (we booked several different rooms due to group size) were nicely appointed with seemingly newer furniture and the bathrooms were furnished with good quality toiletries. The continental breakfast was also sufficient to meet our needs to begin the day. The front desk staff is friendly, very helpful, and well-versed in area attractions, restaurants, and points of interest. We'll be staying here when we visit the area again!

Reviews.Title: “loved this place, great base for exploring area”
Reviews.Author: jaime2202
Reviews.Content: stayed here with a group of friends, great customer service from friendly staff, nice and quiet for chilling out after hard day shopping and clubbing at night. Our room was next to the courtyard right next door to breakfast room. Great for that morning dash in dressing gown to get breakfast and could take into room to watch with breakfast tv. We hired bikes from the stall next to beach and cycled along the front-think we nearly got to malibu(well my legs felt like it-ha ha!) We also walked back from the shopping mall's of santa monica one afternoon- took us an hour walking along the sea front and was great experience stopping in few of the quirky shops and seeing muscle beach-was exhausted by time got back and thank goodness for the great bar across from the hotel. I cant remeber the name but it was great sports/tapa's type place. We even seen few of the stars when out clubbing in main town area- Paris Hilton and my friend even had a converstation with Kirsten Dunst. Stayed her for 7 nights before our road trip to viva las vegas and we all loved it and i hope to get back there one day

Reviews.Title: “Great for long haul recovery”
Reviews.Author: nomadic_family
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a break with a 3 year old at the end of a long haul. Our good experiences started when the lovely man on front desk checked us in early at 9am (for pic of him see Autumnleaf30 review). Our suite room (loft) was fabulous and large and this hotel is 2 minutes from the beach, canal walks, shops and a great cheap Mexican restaurant - El Tarasco. Stars all round from us. We slept well and have nothing but good things to say about the room, location and above all service.

Reviews.Title: “Not recomended”
Reviews.Author: vagabondMexicoCity
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the recomendations on this site . It was a disapointment . I could accept it was an older property but frankly it has no charm . The real problem is it is noisy , very noisy . The road traffic is BAD but worse the walls are so thin you can here passers by talking in the street , at all hours as this is a popular and not quiet area anyway . If that wasnÂ´t enough the internal noise passes from room to room as well and the beds creak so no good for you honeymooners . Conclision very average and overpriced .

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Quiet Quaint- A good choice!”
Reviews.Author: TxGrrl
Reviews.Content: After my husband came back from his six month deployment, we decided to spend a weekend in venice beach. The inn at Venice Beach seemed a good choice, with its short walking distance to the beach and laid back atmosphere. The customer service was superb! Upon checking in, you were treated like royalty. Our room was pretty small, on the first floor and had a good view of the courtyard. We requested near the courtyard after reading some not so favorable reviews of the noise level with the other rooms. There was a mug filled with candy and snacks tied up with pretty ribbon waiting for us when we walked in the room. It was a nice touch! I had no complaints about this hotel. It's very small, but it gives the hotel a quaint small town feeling. If you are up to it, walk down to Santa Monica (the ferris wheel and boardwalk you can see from the beach) just remember it's a three mile walk! We found out the hard way:)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: carollm
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise. After checking out known hotels in the area and the prices that were through the roof, I stumbled on this quaint boutique hotel. When we arrived, the staff is so nice. It is 2 short blocks to the beach. The hotel was clean, both in the lobby and the rooms. The small amenities they give you were such a pleasant surprise, coffee pots in the room, newspapers at your door in the morning, bathrobes and a continental breakfast. The cookies in the afternoon are wonderful. I would definitely stay at this place again. As a matter of fact, we are planning a repeat trip there next year only staying longer than we did (only 3 days this time). It is close to everything, Marina del Rey, Santa Monica, Hollywood, Malibu. Venice Beach is so artistic, so bohemian, and so much fun. everyone is so friendly. we preferred it to the uppity Santa Monica and Malibu.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: Eagertogo
Reviews.Content: After a long trip staying in several hotels, this was such a pleasant surprise. We arrived very late (1am), and were greeted warmly and without fuss. All the desk staff were lovely and helpful. Our room (two queen size beds) was incredibly spacious, clean and very comfortable. We're not talking fancy, but there were lovely details - beautiful lamp shades, good closet space, lovely bathroom products, and attention to details like how towels were folded. Everythin was really clean and fresh, and maintenance was obviously a priority. Our room was right on Washington, which is quite busy. It didn't really matter. Despite some demolition work across the road, the room still felt quiet. It was quite chilly while we were there and had rained so everyone ate breakfast in the breakfast room itself rather than the pretty courtyard. While this space is modest, there was a lovely feeling of shared holidays. The breakfast is simple and generous and made a pleasant change from paying through the nose at a restaurant. The courtyard is as pretty as the picture suggests, and before the rain was a pleasant place to sit and read the paper for a little while. The hotel is located two small blocks from the beach - less than 5 minutes walk (and I'm not big on walking) and you're on the beach without the hassle of taking any transport. There were plenty of really welcoming and afforable places to eat. We made use of the local Big Blue Bus to get to Santa Monica, which meant a bit of walking, and taxis. Word of warning - the Santa Monica taxi dirvers like to take Lincoln Blvd back to Venice Beach. If you're on the 3rd St Blvd (a lot of fun on a sunday aft.), this takes you out of the way at both ends of the trip and costs up to $9.00 more (in peak hour). Ask them to take Ocean (VB taxis did this without being asked). I would recommend Inn at Venice Beach without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find !!!”
Reviews.Author: Puddy4
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel - fantastic location and very friendly and helpful front desk staff. Rooms are quite large and adequate. Bathroom is a little on the small side and the shower head tends to blast you out of the bathroom (very powerful - reminded me of a Seinfeld episode !!!). Lemonade, fruit and cookies are a nice touch in the afternoons and breakfast is more than ample. Vast array of restaurants nearby and the beach a mere 2 minute walk. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay. Would definately come back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel with a B & B Attitude”
Reviews.Author: SMatty
Reviews.Content: I couldn't possibly have been more surprised by a hotel than this one! The entire staff was helpful and pleasant. They provided beach towels and blankets upon request , directions and sightseeing and dining suggestions .The snacks provided in the lobby during the course of the day (fruit, punch and cookies) were such a nice touch and the breakfast assortment offered between 7 and 10 each day was more than adequate to start your day. The rooms were comfortable, clean and priced very reasonably for being located this close to the ocean. All this contributed to an excellent visit to the West Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Great cookies”
Reviews.Author: Bigsister1
Reviews.Content: A very nice clean hotel but a bit pricey for what you get, with a good breakfast served at reasonable hours in a cute small courtyard. Friendly helpful staff. Appreciated the free internet service in the room. We had a large spacious room but it was on the street side. We enjoyed the delicious lemonade and fresh warm cookies in the afternoon. The only negatives were the sound proofing; noise from heavy footsteps and noise from the street kept us up for a while. Also, the shower head was not adjustable and we got blasted out of the shower and it flooded the floor. We enjoyed the restaurants just a few blocks toward the beach as well as strolling the canals which were delightful. the beach is close and quite large with good waves.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accomodations”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodGordon
Reviews.Content: There is nothing special about this hotel. The rooms are OK, BUT, make sure you ask for a room on the back side of the hotel. The first night there, I got a room that was on Washington St. (it felt and sounded like I was in the middle of the road when the city came alive at 6am). Not very pleasant, especially since I checked in at 1am the night before. When I mentioned it to the front desk in the morning, they moved us to another room in the back. The good thing as that they do offer free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place to stay! Located just 2 blocks from the board walk, shopping and great restaurants. The staff is very friendly always greeted you with a smile and hello. The rooms are very spacious and each has either inside or outside balcony. Continental breakfast is served in a romantic patio. The parking is only $4.00 per day, the only thing they may want to add is additional security if you are unable to park undercover. I know that we will return to the Inn at Venice Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Tabby1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in March 2006 and were very happy with our choice. The room was spacious and clean, the breakfast generous and the staff were very friendly. My only negative observation is that there is very poor soundproofing around the bathrooms as has been previously mentioned - I was woken at 7am every morning by the people next door showering etc. - not the best when you are trying to get over an 11 hour flight plus an 8 hour time difference. Other than that, the Inn is terrific value for money and I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to hang your hat and walk to local attractions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 11 nights while in town on business and was not sorry for the choice I made. I was out during the day and was only there for one weekend. I found the rooms (had to be moved once, with notice, when minor renovation needed doing) clean and enjoyed having a small balcony to step out on. The cleaning staff seemed to take their duties seriously and the staff was very helpful. My third floor room had a high, slanting ceiling that gave it a very open, airy impression. The breakfast provided was pretty simple offerings: bagels, toast, cereals, waffles, yogurt, fruit, coffee, tea. Low protein, but an adaquate start to the day and free as well; those with certain dietary requirements may wish to take note. I found it easy to walk to the beach, boardwalk, a good variety of local restaurants and convenience stores and other neat places in Venice itself. There are a couple downsides: 1) noise. You can tell when other guests are using the shower, as the acoustic separation of rooms is not good. The front of the building faces a major thoroughfare, with traffic starting early and ending late and there is a popular restaurant right across the side street. 2) while I did not expect the place to be decked out like the Beverly Hilton, there were a number of minor "fit and finish" issues: loose bathroom doorknob, label adhesive left on sliding glass door, cracked tiles in bathroom, stuff like that. Irrespective, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Inn at Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Inn at Venice Beach for 5 nights in the beginning of November and were delighted with it. The staff were great - so friendly and really helpful. There was always someone available on the desk to answer any questions. The complimentary cookies and juices at reception were a nice touch. Complimentary breakfast of bagels / toasts / cereals / juices / fruit etc was more than adequate for our needs. The room we had overlooked the courtyard so it was nice and quiet, spacious and clean. We had a rental which we parked at the inn and we never worried about security during our stay. The location was just great and it was easy to get around - not too far from the airport, but right next to Santa Monica - the best of both worlds! I would definitely stay here again, and would recommend it to anyone, particularly because of the staff who were so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful petite hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a night just before Christmas-- what a refreshing little hotel. The night manager greeted us in the parking lot and gave us a cart for the luggage, the complimentary breakfast was satisfying and the inner courtyard was charming, reminding one of a Spanish hacienda. The room was clean, the price reasonable and the location cannot be beat. A small jewel of a spot. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Cooksister
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn after reading a couple of very positive reviews on this site and we were not disappointed. I had looked for something in the area at my price range and kept finding fleabags so I was really pleased to find the Inn. We had just endured a 12 hour transatlantic flight so we were all a little tired and fed-up. What better way to revive ourselves than with the freshly-baked complimentary cookies on the reception desk?!? On subsequent days there was also a fruit basket and freshly squeezed juice, all compliments of the hotel. The location is another HUGE bonus. It was a quick and easy drive from LAX airport, and we were only 2-3 blocks from the beach. So every morning we could take a walk on the beach before breakfast, and stroll on the beach at sunset. The markets (and the endessley fascinating passing parade) of Venice Beach is about a 5 minute walk and both Santa Monica and Marina del Rey are 5 minutes by car. The rooms are enormous by European standards (although I gather pretty average by American standards!) and nicely furnished. We had a queen-sized bed and a rollaway bed in our room and it never felt too crowded. Our room faced the street, so there was some traffic noise in the morning, but nothing too bad. The room was very well equipped - there were more free toiletries than we had at any other hotel over our 17 day trip and they also provided bathrobes, which is an obsession of mine ;-) If silence is a priority, make sure to ask for a room facing onto the delicious little courtyard in the middle of the building. It's a really lovely little public area that doubles up as an overflow for the breakfast room and looks great with the lush plants and little fountain. The breakfast (served in the room adjacent to the courtyard) was good - dry cereals, instant oats, yoghurt, fruit, a selection of hot drinks, bread, bagels, waffles, Philly cream cheese, syrup, jam/jelly etc etc. And nobody seems to mind if you come downstairs, grab some food and eat in your room. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, and credit has to go to the young lady who on our first night recommended Tony P's (in Marina del Rey) for dinner on our first night. We could not believe the view when we walked in - you are RIGHT on the marina! We ate in the enclosed balcony area and had really delicious food (mmmm, clam chowder!) - and it was really reasonable for what you were getting (and downright cheap if paying in Pounds!) The only negatives were the fact that we could not for love or money get our (non wi-fi) laptop computer to work, despite lots of advice from the staff) and the fact that when you are in the bathroom, you can hear every movement in the adjacent bathroom (the staff did warn us about this and suggested we sleep with the bathroom door closed...). But apart from those two very minor gripes, I absolutely loved the Inn and I would definitely stay there again. Oh, and as somebody else has mentioned, the $4 per night parking is really reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Value, Top-Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We sere pleasantly suprprised not only with our room at the Inn but at the hospitality of the staff as well. Within 15 minutes of checking the housekeeping staff delivered a gift from the manager - a coffee mug filled with candy and treats. They also give you two complimentary bottles of water in the room. The room and bathroom were clean. The bathtub did have a slow drain but nothing serious. The hotel was also eco-friendly and offered many options for conservation. As far as the location the room we had was facing Washington Avenue and if you are a light sleeper I would recommend requesting a room facing the rear of the hotel. Parking is free and hotel is within walking distance to the Venice Beach Strip. Free WiFi!! If you are interested the Hotel also offers information on tourist offerings in the LA area.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit even better than the 1st!”
Reviews.Author: Heavens
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in Sept 2004 and was exceptinally pleased on the hotels location and the staff's hospitality here. On our return to LA this year we had no hesitation in re-booking the 'Inn at Venice Beach'. On arriving we were greeted by 'Emad' who remembered us from last year and advised us that he had a lovely suite for us (we had booked a standard room). The room was fantastic and had an upstairs (the bedrtoom) and a sizeable living area downstairs. The standard rooms werre big enough, but the suite was enormous! The stay was fantatsic again, as we knew it would be. There were renovations being carried out at the hotel but the noise was during the day and was minimal. We would not have noticed the rennovations had we not seen the sign in the reception lobby. The hotel is also ideally located as it's about 2 blocks away from the beach and it is such a nice wals to Venice along the boardwalk. The amenities nearby aee great. There is an excellent Mexican restaurant next door called 'Baja Cantina' and a lovely Italian called 'The Pasta Factory' not too far either. Excellent hotel - we will go back again!

Reviews.Title: “great service, close to beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a little conflicted with this review because there were so many nice things about this hotel, but there was one thing that I didn't like that is a pet peeve of mine. I'll get straight to the pet peeve....I hate when I can loudly hear the shower running in the next room, and I was awoke two of the three days by the neighboring tenant. I want a quiet room where I can sleep great. Other than the shower noise it was fairly quiet. But that did bother me. Now to the positives...The staff was very, very friendly. Very nice. The location is great if you want to spend a lot of time on the beach or stroll the boardwalk. And rental bikes and skates are a block away. It is also not too far from the airport on side streets. The free continental breakfast is nice and welcomed and the room was a decent size, though I wish they had king beds in all the rooms. We had to get a queen, which is a little small for my wife and I, and we probably won't do that again. I also wish it was a little closer to the freeway, so if you plan on driving all over L.A. there might be a better location. But if the beach is a primary objective, then this is as good as it gets. I also like that the parking was only $4/day. So many hotels charge almost as much as the room it seems. And it was okay that there wasn't a bellman. The bag trolley is right there to use and you don't have to go far. The hotel is small, which is nice. Anyway, I would rate this higher if there wasn't the noise issue and if there were a few more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel! Loved it here!!”
Reviews.Author: ftbllgrl899
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hotels in which we have ever stayed!! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful-they helped us get on a LA tour, and every day there were fresh baked cookies on the front desk! If you wanted to go for a run or a swim on the beach, the front desk would hang onto your room key and belongings for you. The room very comfortable and clean. The hotel is about 3 blocks from the beach and the boardwalk, and from a number of restaurants and shops. The value is great for the price we paid. I definitely recommend staying here when you visit Venice Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: adventurousAng
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend and my parents in early June. I chose this after reading the reviews on the websight because all the accommodation in Santa Monica was too expensive. As long as you are prepared for the interesting things that you will see at Venice Beach this hotel was fine. The room was clean (we stayed in an apartment), the staff on the desk friendly and the breakfast was ok if you like everything loaded in sugar. We rented a car and drove round LA and Malibu which was good. We went into Santa Monica at night to get something to eat. The markets are around the corner and in peak times it is really busy with all sorts of weird and wonderful people. Quite an interesting buzz. But remember it is LA!! (not the prettiest/cleaniest place in the world)

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not what we expected, especially after reading all the reviews. Bathroom was dirty. Staff not very friendly or helpful. Signs posted inside and outside lobby stating facility contains chemicals known to cause cancer or birth defects and reproductive harm....brochure available at front desk. When inquiring about sign and a brochure at the front desk, was told all buildings in CA have this sign posted. Front desk stated no brochures available and was unable to specify what the "chemicals" were. We asked 2 different employees and were told the exact same thing. We looked for signs on other buildings and hotels in Venice Beach and the surrounding area throughout our stay but didn't see any signs like this. Room had a mini refrigerator which was nice to keep our drinks cold. Continental breakfast just OK. Hotel parking limited and spaces very narrow. Additional parking is available in lot on side street adjacent to hotel. Would try a different hotel if in the area again.

HotelInfo.Name: Inn at Venice Beach
HotelInfo.Address: 327 Washington Blvd, Venice, Los Angeles, CA 90291
